newsitem.title: USA: SEC may demand bond clearing level disclosure - WSJ.
newsitem.headline: SEC may demand bond clearing level disclosure - WSJ.

text.p: The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission is investigating whether underwriters are selling bonds at artificially low yields and might ask them to disclose a bond's new issue price on the prospectus, the Wall Street Journal said in Friday's electronic edition.

According to securities lawyers and SEC officials, SEC officials from its division of corporate finance met a dozen investment bankers and one issuer to talk about whether new bond issue prices were properly disclosed, the paper said.
The agency is considering asking underwriters to put a bond'd "clearing level" or price on the new issue market on a sticker on the front of a deal's final prospectus, the newspaper said.

"The staff is looking at this to make sure we're getting the right disclosure," Meredith Cross, deputy director of the SEC division, was quoted as saying. "We're trying to find out what the practices are."
